definition: A major concern across reflections is the need to check every reference that AI supplies, as many citations are fabricated, incomplete, or mis-attributed. The effort required to confirm the existence and relevance of sources offsets some of the time-saving benefits of AI.
keywords: fabricated references, citation checking, source validation, false bibliography, reference accuracy, verification workload

definition: Engaging with AI outputs forced students to compare generated text with original literature, deepening their understanding of the material. The process promoted more active reading and encouraged reflective evaluation of both AI and their own knowledge.
keywords: critical evaluation, deepened understanding, reflective learning, comparative analysis, active reading, metacognition

theme_name: Ethical and Attitudinal Concerns toward AI Use
definition: Reflections reveal mixed feelings about academic integrity, personal bans, and disciplinary norms surrounding AI. Some students view AI as a threat to independent thought, while others see it as a permissible tool when used responsibly.
keywords: academic integrity, ethical concerns, personal bans, acceptability, authorial authenticity, discipline policies

theme_name: Academic Utility â€“ Drafting, Summarizing, and Idea Generation
definition: Students found AI useful for producing outlines, drafts, concise summaries, and for brainstorming new angles on a topic. These functions helped them overcome writer's block and structure their arguments more efficiently.
keywords: drafting, summarization, brainstorming, outline creation, idea generation, structure, writing assistance

theme_name: Reliability and Accuracy of AI-Generated Content
definition: Students repeatedly noted that AI outputs can be both impressively coherent and strikingly erroneous. While the language often appears scholarly, factual mistakes, oversimplifications, and outright fabrications are common, prompting caution.
keywords: factual errors, hallucinations, misinformation, accuracy, credibility, false statements, content quality
